website_summaries.verdict: This simple yet sturdy dog training leash is made from 100% cotton. Measuring 5/8-inches wide it isn't too bulky for small dogs.
pros: Made from natural fibers, which are soft and strong
Four leash lengths to choose from
Swivel clip helps stop the leash from twisting and tangling
cons: May not be wide enough for extra large breeds

customer_reviews.title: Long leash; short lifespan!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these leashes in late August. I was looking for an inexpensive longer leash for my two small dogs so my 87-year old mother could let the dogs outside without having to go out herself. They weren't exactly well-made, but served the purpose for a short while. The other day I was using one and the button broke off of the clip, so now I can't use it. I guess I got what I paid for. My advice is to pay a little more and get a nicer leash.
customer_reviews.author: Anne From MD

customer_reviews.title: Quality lead. Fair price. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lead that's well constructed with good materials. It's definitely for a small pet, but the brass component is a little large and heavy, weighing down the connection on the harness of an eleven-pound cat. The upside is that it's well made and doesn't stop the cat from roaming within it's 10-foot limit, but that's why four stars instead of five. It's gently used and the webbing has held up without fraying. The hand loop is comfortable without scratchy glue spots or fraying that occurred with other leads. It's never exposed to water, so consider a waterproof lead if that's your situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Pen

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend going for a nylon lead that is thicker to ...
customer_reviews.text: Its very thin and not very wide. I have a larger dog and due to the cotton material, if I'm not paying attention and the dog pulls or runs, you WILL get burns on your hand, and due to the width it digs into you. If my dog is running past me with this lead flapping in the wind behind him, If I can't step on it forget. I would recommend going for a nylon lead that is thicker to grab on too. Maybe for a small dog that cannot get enough speed or strength to do any damage; this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Fellow

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!  Does not hold up!
customer_reviews.text: This lead lasted only about 4 weeks before it was in tatters. Mind you, my Justzon lead is much older and has not one thread frayed. Lesson learned, I will ONLY buy Justzon Leads which are cheaper and have a lifetime warranty. UPDATE: I found the best way to repurpose this otherwise worthless lead into something useful. I braided it and turned it into a pull toy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for a run!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite leash to use when I take my dog for a run. It's long so she can run ahead a little or fall behind a little. I make a loop with the handle part of the leash and cinch it around my waist so that I don't have to hold the leash throughout the run. It's a very sturdy, but light material.
customer_reviews.author: JuJoDuDo

customer_reviews.title: Basic leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a very poor quality leash for a great price. I cannot rate this above a 2/5 since my dog broke the leash within the first few walks. He pulls a lot and was able to pull this around the corner and it snapped instantly. I opted to pay a bit more for a higher quality leash
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Good quality leash
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my leash, you pay for what you get, a lot of the leashes that I did see they were very cheap, and think they might of been made that way too, so it is best to get a name band. I needed the leash to let my dog out, I do not have a backyard, this works great if you don't want to go out with your dog sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: We have used this leash maybe 3 times and the threading is completely falling apart! We have used it only on grass in our backyard to try and teach our dog the "come" command. I wish I could have given it zero stars. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: H. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great leash and is tough enough for my Pitbull
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50 lb Pitbull and she has a lot of muscle and I have the 10' black leash that I use to walk her everyday. The leash has lasted and will last quite a bit longer except where I hold because when I get in I clip the clasp around the handle. So now it is starting to fray and I can't get it to stop. Only reason I am having to buy another one within 4 mo of the original is due to my error. Other then that this leash passes the tough girl test by me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Good

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It has held up so far with our 60lb shepherd who does occasionally like to pull. We've been using it to play around in the yard since we don't have a fence. It's light enough that he doesn't really notice it, which is good because he was not previously leash trained before we got him. It does take a little longer to dry if it gets wet, but otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fastener
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my chihuahua, he needed a long lead. Because of his size the part attaching to his harness is very heavy . More suited for a larger dog.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash
customer_reviews.text: I got this for dog training. The strong cotton weave, is secure - yet it doesn't hurt your hand like some of the synthetic leashes. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sdw

customer_reviews.title: Great length, not great material
customer_reviews.text: Needed a 10 foot lead for puppy training. This is a great price but not so great material. The material is very rough and if you have a dog that is pulling or is big and string you'll more than likely get rope burns until they learn to stop pulling. Training a 35 pound, 4.5 month old puppy involves lots of pulling and we got rope burns from the leash. Pay a bit more for another material (leather or sifter cotton/nylon) if you want a comfortable 10 foot lead.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect length and surprisingly durable! It’s perfect for working with your dog if you want him/her to be able to go out from you a few feet but still have something to keep your pooch or the pooch you’re working with from running off.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Shop It

customer_reviews.title: Cotton is not the way to go.
customer_reviews.text: Cotton is not the way to go. I got rope burn the first time my dog ran through the yard. My refund was promptly issued from Amazon though.
customer_reviews.author: Dunfee1452

customer_reviews.title: Lead On!
customer_reviews.text: Dog has further square footage. She's happy. I feel like a cowgirl as much as I have to wrangle the damned extra slack, though! I would've liked it if the lead felt sturdier. It's nice if you want a softer lead. But, I guess I'm picky!
customer_reviews.author: Vita

customer_reviews.title: Easy to chew right through
customer_reviews.text: My dog literally chewed through this cheap cotton thing in less than 30 seconds when I was looking away and she was gone. Thank god she didn’t eat the neighbors chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Reuter

customer_reviews.title: Basic but exactly what i need.
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult to find a 10 foot dog lead so I was happy to find one on Amazon. It's a basic lead but that is what I wanted so it's fine for me. I have a Welsh corgi. Corgyn are short dogs so naturally they walk under bushes. I once had the standard lead hook come open because a branch caught on the little lever that you pull back to release the clasp. This appears to be standard on all leads. I have remedied this by adding a second clasp. I'd rate this 5 stars if it had a double clasp. Black is very boring but, at least when I ordered, that was what was available.
customer_reviews.author: Therese D. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, as advertised, but it has a seam in the middle of it that isn't really well sewn. I worry that that part of the leash might weaken as I have a large dog. I don't think there should be a seam, it should be one piece.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burkart

customer_reviews.title: The lock mechanism didn't close properly and my dog could have easily got off leash
customer_reviews.text: The clip spring malfunctioned while taking my dog on a beach walk. The lock mechanism didn't close properly and my dog could have easily got off leash. Dangerous product when walking a dog around cars.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Geldard

customer_reviews.title: My favorite lead
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lead. It's way softer than nylon and cheaper than leather. I have not had to replace my first one from 8 years ago, I just needed more for more dogs! It's very lightweight, and the puppy likes to carry his lead in his mouth when we walk, and he hasn't damaged it. I would not recommend this if your dog chews leashes, though.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B

customer_reviews.title: Nice Leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, soft, sturdy cotton leash. If I have anything negative to say about it it is that the hook is almost too big and sturdy. I bought this because I like to have the security of having a "normal" leash at the end of mt Flexi leash for more control over my dog. It allows me to keep him safe.It also allows me to remove it from the flexi leash and use it alone where leashes longer than 6' aren't permitted. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rootessa

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a great leash. I was expecting it to feel like a nylon leash but it does not because it is made of cotton. It feels like a cotton webbing belt. It was more narrow than expected but after 3 weeks of use, it is holding up well and does not retain the dog smell I have come to expect from other leashes. The latch was a little tough to get open at first but has become easier as it has been used. I am very pleased with my purchase and will purchase it again when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: supercrew80

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted a way to have my dogs in the front yard without having to hold a leash or steak anything in the front yard. I bought one blue and one black. I looped one through the handle of the other so they are attached and put it around the tree in the front yard and they love it. With both leashes together they have enough room to run around the yard and play while I'm doing yard work.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Leash Broke After 2 Months of use, suggest a nylon leash instead.
customer_reviews.text: Well the leash worked great for about 2 months. Then becuase of the cotton Material the leash just snapped one day. I would reccomend this leash it is great however I would suggest finding one made from a stronger material. Perhaps a Nylon Leash would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Best training leash/everyday leash you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I have a young adult Shiloh Shepherd that I am training for agility and CD competitions as well as obedience. I use this leash for everything. It has great texture so your hands never slip and don't have to struggle to hold onto the leash if you have a dog that pulls (like she did as a pup). Also, I've taken it in the water to go swimming and it holds up great. Also, it is a great leash for walks because it is long enough to allow your dog some exploration but not too long to make close healing a tangled mess. For the price, you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: KTSheree

customer_reviews.title: Latch broke after less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for less than a month and the clip has already broke off where you latch it to your dogs leash. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L

customer_reviews.title: Fit for Purpose
customer_reviews.text: The product is durable and works best with our larger dogs which include a malamute, two golden retrievers, a yellow lab and a german shepherd. I would not recommend it for dogs under around thirty to forty pounds. Our beagle and our spaniel tend to run it under and around obstacles. The length is good for open areas but can be a bit problematic in woodland terrain. The price is competitive and the grip is both solid and comfortable even on four hour mountain hikes.
customer_reviews.author: daniel j. silvia

customer_reviews.title: Sort of OK
customer_reviews.text: I have two 18 lb dogs and love 6 ft cotton web leashes for them. They are hard to find locally since they seem to fit the category of training leads, so I was happy to find them on Amazon. However, they have a larger clasp than my previous ones and tend to weigh the dogs down. They are ok for a harness, but if you have small dogs, be aware that for some reason, the clasp is bigger than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Villager

customer_reviews.title: Great training lead
customer_reviews.text: I use this one for my Shiba puppy to practice recall outside. It is a great training tool for dogs that don't heel very well and can't be off leash. I let her wander to the end of it and try to get her to come back. It is a great way to slowly increase the distance of her recall and also taking it to parks where there is more stimuli that she can wander off a little further and then again practice recall.
customer_reviews.author: jwizzle

customer_reviews.title: wonderful. put it in the washing machine every couple ...
customer_reviews.text: wonderful. put it in the washing machine every couple weeks after folding in thirds and putting a rubber band around it. it is not too heavy as many of the leads are. i have had them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Decent lead.
customer_reviews.text: This lead is narrow and not as thick and heavy as I expected. It will work but I was hoping for something that had more quality.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Tate

customer_reviews.title: Four Paws Cotton Web Lead
customer_reviews.text: Really like this leash. This is the second one I have purchased. Light yet has substance. Quiet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality.
customer_reviews.text: The metal piece you press with your thumb broke within the first few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: This lead is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Its cotton, easy on your hand, lightweight, and sturdy at the same time. The price is excellent and what I like about this leash is that my trainor uses the same one and this means that he is particular so I want the same lead. I like that I can shorten it when necessary because of how its made. It is a nice fit in the hand too. Buy it, I wish it was in more colors though,
customer_reviews.author: S. Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Best Lead in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I love this because it is all cotton, its easy to hold if you need to shorten it while walking and my coach used the same lead and he used nothing else of that. I love the colors to choose from too. I also find this much more flexible to hold and reasonably priced. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Good Training Tool
customer_reviews.text: Good leash for puppy training, you can control your puppy, but there are still lots of room for puppy to wander freely.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: This leash was so cheap my dog shredded it in minutes. Don’t buy it. Invest in higher quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good length for dog to explore
customer_reviews.text: For my beagle, this leash length works well for letting her explore during walks, but it isn't so long that I can't maintain good control. I considered a 15 foot leash, but am glad I went with the 10 foot length. The construction is solid. I have been using this leash daily for over a month now with no complaint. It gets dragged on the ground and through brambles, and hasn't shown any signs of wear yet. I expect to get over a year of twice daily use out of it. If you have a dog that doesn't have to explore EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE, the leash will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Schejbal

customer_reviews.title: We got our dog Mia on July 4th (our little ...
customer_reviews.text: We got our dog Mia on July 4th (our little resuce) and decided to give her plenty of room when we take her out. This does the trick. Gave 4 stars because I wish it was a little more thinner in width. My dog is only 16 pounds. But there is not much out there for a 10ft leash. I would buy again, wish they had differrent colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality leash. The clasp is heavier construction but isn't too heavy for our small dog. I like the shorter leash for walking the dog where he may come in contact with other dogs. His alfa male instinct is a lot bigger than he is and tends to get him in trouble at times. The price is really good.
customer_reviews.author: iluvqps

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Not very strong for large dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Hewaply made. Not very strong for large dogs. I have a german sheperd and it isnt strong enough for her
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Anywho

customer_reviews.title: very cheap quality and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: this leash is very poorly made. the holding strap literally ripped right off the actual lead. this was very disappointing as it only lasted 10 days. i bought this same leash about a year ago and it was perfect. this was very unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what more needs to be said. It’s longer and works for training purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Great lead
customer_reviews.text: Holds up well even with my power chewer and can easily tie knot when she bites through. She does love her walks and we explore daily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy
customer_reviews.text: I loved the leash at the beginning; it was my second one. It gave my dog some room to just be a dog. However, within a week he pulled hard on the leash and it broke like the first one. If this leash is intended for smaller dogs, not German Shepherds, then it should be advertised as such. Sorry guys good intent but bad results.
customer_reviews.author: ricardo soto

customer_reviews.title: Good keash
customer_reviews.text: I use this leash often on my little Pom - but the latch unit is so big and heavy, I try to find an old smaller leash and put the smaller, light latch on for my ten pound Pom. Quality good, lasts for years outside in the weather, too.
customer_reviews.author: Lila M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: The front loop ripped off in about a week. It wasn't even used that much. They won't replace it. Only return it... So now I am out more $ for now to get a different new one.
customer_reviews.author: Aislin

customer_reviews.title: thin
customer_reviews.text: It is about half the thickness of the one I am replacing. Too thin and light weight for my purposes, but if you are using it to walk your dog it would be lighter to hold. My 50 pound dog could bite through it in half a second.
customer_reviews.author: Joycep48

customer_reviews.title: Less than a week, already broken
customer_reviews.text: we have been using this lead since Saturday. It started fraying less than 24 hours of use, and completely snapped today (Tuesday). Our puppy hasn't been chewing on it, all of the fraying was from normal use. Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and best deal I could find online for a 20ft leash. I'm using it to train my furry friend to "come" and "return." I also use it when we go hiking-- makes me feel confident that I if he ventures off on his own he won't get too far.
customer_reviews.author: CATHERINE

customer_reviews.title: So far so good been using it for nearly a month now on ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good been using it for nearly a month now on our 75 pound Golden Retriever. But never really put the quality of the material to the test yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good alternative. Gives her enough lead to be able ...
customer_reviews.text: Descent quality for the price. We use for agility training and running around. Unfortunately there are no dog parks where I live and dogs have to be leashed when outside 100% of the time. This is a good alternative. Gives her enough lead to be able to run around and play.
customer_reviews.author: MsgrimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a 10 foot lead anywhere but online. Even then, it was difficult to find one that wasn't retractable. This lead came quickly and is absolutely perfect for taining my puppy. The quality is great and it seems durable but soft.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good strong leash
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I expected it would be. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that the cotton web material picks up a lot of stickers, other seeds, and dry grass when we go out into wild meadows or more arid terrain. A nylon blend might be more resistant to all the "hitchhikers"! But overall this is a great leash for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper22

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. Lets me give my dog a little bit more space when I want to. She is only 40 lbs and doesn't pull hard. I had a German Shepherd this probably wouldn't have worked for. Maybe an extra grab handle at the six foot length would be helpful for a bigger hard pulling dog. This works great for us!
customer_reviews.author: gbbrehm

customer_reviews.title: Nice light, strong leash
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it is supposed to do.....light weight and strong....I have a 50lb Irish Setter that is VERY strong...when she wants to pull, she can pull hard! This leash is holding up well and after three weeks of two walks a day it still looks like it did when I opened it. I'm probably going to get one of the 6 foot ones next.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I don't like having my dog on a leash but some places I have to and this is great. He doesn't pull on this because he has room to walk in front or behind me. The material is soft so its not to rough of your hands. We went camping and kept my dog on the leash so he could walk around the campsite with us.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Balzano

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty leash. I have a big dog and am not worried that he will break the leash.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Great training leash.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Solid swivel snap, large enough to be comfortable placing and removing with easy movement. The cotton is soft to my hand and the length is as described. I'm glad I ordered two, I will use these!
customer_reviews.author: Kulamom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality leash for price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this leash a while and it's holding up better than others I've tried, they usually fray. My dog is about 50 lbs and pulls pretty hard sometimes and this leash is still in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered & delivered in "Prime" time
customer_reviews.text: It is what I wanted/needed. A longer leash for our dog in the color and manufacture sought. The wife wanted it most as our extension leash is hard for her to use, and the 6' leash didn't allow our dog freedom of movement. When you get what you want, and the wife is happy, what more can a husband want.
customer_reviews.author: Chazandru

customer_reviews.title: I got it for a Neighboor she loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for a Neighboor she loves it. She got a small dog and I'm surprise it work for small dogs too
customer_reviews.author: rosario corio

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size lead and the material is 100% cotton as stated. Perfect. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: samiam

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Keeps my nosy Schnauzer out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Keeps my nosy Schnauzer out of the cat food and litter while giving him "roaming room".
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality broke
customer_reviews.text: Just got last night only used in house to control my Shepherd leash split
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great for Off Lead Training!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lead for allowing your dog freedom and working on recall. It's "soft" and although keeping it coiled without tangling when not is use is a challenge for me, it's great to have for those times you need to have your dog on a leash, but there is plenty of room for them to roam and explore safely!
customer_reviews.author: BarbR

customer_reviews.title: dog leash.
customer_reviews.text: i use this leash to let my dog out the back door by himself while i watch from the door. i deff feel its secure enough for him (he is 20lbs.) and he has enough room to roam alone.
customer_reviews.author: CherrySnow

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the great price & service
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled to find this long line at this price. Most places are charging about 10.00 more (ouch). Thanks for the great price & service. : )
customer_reviews.author: Jessica T.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like im using a shoelace with a hook on other end.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like dang shoe lace. Don't know how i didn't catch it.
customer_reviews.author: tony beltran

customer_reviews.title: Easy on My Hands
customer_reviews.text: This lead worked the best for walking my dog in a city. I could stop and let her sniff the grass and shrubs and let the lead out as she went without worrying about her getting away. The cotton is easily held and I washed the lead a few times by hand when it got noticeably dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Judy E. Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT Quality, especially for the price,("Regardless" of the price... Excellent quality)
customer_reviews.author: NCLREZ

customer_reviews.title: good strong leash
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price. paid a lot more for lesser quality products elsewhere. Easy to use I will never use a retractable leash again
customer_reviews.author: homer

customer_reviews.title: The material is soft and the snap is sturdy. No need to look further
customer_reviews.text: This leash is exactly what it should be. The material is soft and the snap is sturdy. No need to look further, this is a quite serviceable leash.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: 15 foot lead
customer_reviews.text: Great for training purposes. Not too heavy. We use it for training our horse also.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: ... had for a while now and has held up good even with some light chewing from dog
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a while now and has held up good even with some light chewing from dog. Much cheaper than ones sold at pet store and no real difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of "bang" for your buck. Good quality good price.
customer_reviews.text: The clasp is high quality and the leash has held up well so far. This was a far better value than what is offered at local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Huff

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: It's just what I was looking for. The material is strong and durable. My youngest pup just turned 6 months and we're working on recalls, so this is great for training purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and thin, clip broke within a month. Spent a bit more recently and got a leash I love.
customer_reviews.author: Snapdragon703

customer_reviews.title: Leash
customer_reviews.text: Great leash, just that the latch was a little heavy for a Yorkie.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Smith

customer_reviews.title: I was afraid to order this leash, but it ROCKS.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a review from someone with a small dog, here it is. I was unsure if this leash would last through my Chihuahua/Schnauzer/Mix puppy's leash and harness training, but it is still in almost perfect condition, even after she bit and tore at it (even sneaking it away to use it as a chew toy while I was asleep or not looking).
customer_reviews.author: SnoWhite

customer_reviews.title: Not time yet
customer_reviews.text: This leash looks very promising for the spring and summer. It's too long now because it drags in the snow and slush faster than I can wrap it around my hand. This is not a fault of the product, which is well-made, just poor timing on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Rick and Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great leash! 3rd one purchased, will be back!
customer_reviews.author: KathyDingo

customer_reviews.title: OMG this is a cotton web dog leash with metal ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is a cotton web dog leash with metal clip!! WOW! It's exactly what you expect when you order it. Nothing more, nothing less.
customer_reviews.author: HowdagerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just what it said it was, does what I need thank you
customer_reviews.author: Allison Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Quality questionable.
customer_reviews.text: Metal clip on end broke off the product is not sturdy for medium to large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of knots.
customer_reviews.text: I like the length of this leash and the fact that it is cotton, but it is so easy to get knots in the leash and they are impossible to get out once the dog pulls, and they tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Mom's Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I need long-lines when running Nose Work with our dogs. Our 20 ft lines that we use for distance training in other sports are just a bit too hard to handle in Nose Work, so I bought the 10 footers. They're great quality, and nice colors!
customer_reviews.author: Amos

customer_reviews.title: The dog lead is excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: The dog lead is excellent!!! The lead is very strong but not stiff. The clasp to go on the collar of the dog is large so that makes it very easy to clip on when the dog isn't standing still. Would definitely buy this again!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Plourde

customer_reviews.title: The length is wonderful - I can keep walking while he sniffs to ...
customer_reviews.text: The length is wonderful - I can keep walking while he sniffs to his heart's delight, he inevitably catches up. The snap is made of quality, we've used it every day for several months and no frays!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: How could my Black 15 Foot Cotton Web Dog Lead ...
customer_reviews.text: How could my Black 15 Foot Cotton Web Dog Lead not meet my expectations? It is Black, 15 feet, made of cotton web, and it is a dog lead! Not too many decisions to make with this product!
customer_reviews.author: BarryDBerger

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend the 15 foot
customer_reviews.text: If you have to tie up our little pooch for any reason, I would recommend the 15 foot lead
customer_reviews.author: GAL

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my puppy, which was recv'd in perfect shipping condition. It worked well until she chewed through it. Puppies & their chewing...
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hart

customer_reviews.title: I think this lead will be perfect to train our new pup
customer_reviews.text: I think this lead will be perfect to train our new pup, giving him the space to go further and come when called. I hope! Excellent product, although I wish the clasp was a big smaller. It works regardless. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: V. Dunne

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good. Replaced our old one that our dog chewed up and knotted a billion times but the clasp circle is a little small for her harness that has two hooks that need clasping. Not an issue just sometimes have to jiggle to untangle
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. Nice to find one in the length I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has been in use out of doors for more than 1 year and has held up great
customer_reviews.author: Mang

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The snap is larger than I had hoped for my 13 pound terrier
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Where's quality control?
customer_reviews.text: Clasp was broken. When we opened the package, we were disappointed that the metal was not working.
customer_reviews.author: Gene M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality. I only used it twice with a 15lb puppy before it broke.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nissley

product_meta.title: Four Paws 10-Foot Cotton Web Lead
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:30'Manufactured of 100% natural cotton, Four Paws Dog Training Leads are preferred and used by professional dog handlers and trainers. 5/8" wide and feature a solid bronze swivel snap for extra durability. Available in lengths from 6 feet to 50 feet in black, red or blue
feature_bullets: Four Paws keeps pets secure with 100% cotton leads
Features a solid bronze swivel snap for extra durability
Used by professional dog handlers and trainers
Available in red, black, and blue
5/8 inches wide with 6 lengths: 6 feet, 10 feet, 15 feet, 20 feet, 30 feet, 50 feet
